intro: Cerastium hirtellum, commonly known as hairy mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically pink or white, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. Cerastium hirtellum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
